meanings.definition: Denoting a period of time in the past that was idyllically happy and peaceful.
meanings.sent1: The memories of those halcyon days bring a smile to my face.
meanings.sent2: The small town had a halcyon atmosphere that made everyone feel at ease.
meanings.sent3: In the halcyon village, even the grumpiest old man was always cheerful.
meanings.sent4: Her halcyon childhood was like a dream that she never wanted to wake up from.
meanings.sent5: The painting captured the essence of halcyon days with its bright colors and peaceful setting.

meanings.definition: A mythical bird said by ancient writers to breed in a nest floating at sea at the winter solstice, charming the wind and waves into calm.
meanings.sent1: Legends speak of the halcyon as a magical bird that calms the stormy seas.
meanings.sent2: Sailors believed sighting a halcyon bird meant safe travels ahead.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous children joked about finding a halcyon egg on the beach.
meanings.sent4: Her voice was as soothing as the song of a halcyon bird on a peaceful day.
meanings.sent5: The old sailor's tales were filled with descriptions of the majestic halcyon bird and its calming presence.
